title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 September 2014 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
00:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki

08:52 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki

09:00 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <lucaa> has quit  
10:53 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <cjd> Good morning, does anyone know if there is a way to make a scheduler job start automatically when it's imported from a XAR ?  
11:02 <cjd> ahh it seems to have started up  
11:02 <cjd> now lets see if I can reproduce this :)  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/LoginTest/testRedirectPreservesPOSTParameters/ does it means that Bootstrap is not loaded after 10 seconds?  
11:04 <polx> has quit  
11:07 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <tmortagne> [WARN] will restart myxwiki.org in 5 minutes  
11:47 <polx> has quit  
11:49 <gdelhumeau> I propose to start using webjars to bundle jQuery, instead of copying it in our source tree  
11:49 <gdelhumeau> any objection?  
11:49 <vmassol> I don't know the cost of using webjars but tmortagne told me it was ok  
11:50 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: +1  
11:50 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <tmortagne> whatever the cost right now (which is very low) once we fix caching it should be negligible  
11:51 <tmortagne> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11056  
11:54 <tmortagne> note that we could also allow "enabling" using google jsapi to lower even more the load on the server for public websites  
11:54 <vmassol> I'm planning to work on the webjar permission issue this afternoon  
11:55 <tmortagne> that means having some abstraction layer on our side  
11:56 <vmassol> oops seems I'm the first one to hit myxwiki.org  
11:56 <vmassol> (using a subwiki http request… hope it's ok)  
11:59 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is no reason for it to be an issue AFAIK  
11:59 <vmassol> ok, there's one problem I've noticed though  
11:59 <vmassol> the watchlist has wrong links  
11:59 <vmassol> when this happens  
11:59 <vmassol> we need to fix this  
12:01 <tmortagne> the links are wrong when targeting which wiki ?  
12:02 <tmortagne> since all descriptors have explicit domain we should have all the required information to generate proper links, we have this issue "officially" when there is no main wiki descriptor  
12:04 <tmortagne> maybe the url factory wrongly associate the main wiki and the the first URL in the xcontext without even looking at the descriptor in some cases  
12:15 <vmassol> if you check the watchlist we get every day from xwiki.org  
12:16 <vmassol> you'll see that sometimes when you click the links they're wrong  
12:16 <vmassol> they point to the wrong wikis  
12:16 <vmassol> I haven't traced why  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: I want to upgrade jquery for 6.2.1  
12:17 <gdelhumeau> using webjar  
12:23 <polx> has quit  
12:24 <evalica> has quit  
12:26 <lucaa> has quit  
12:41 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:09 <lucaa> has quit  
13:26 <Denis> has quit  
13:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:43 <vmassol> guys, question for you  
13:43 <vmassol> I'd like to add some debugging logs when we shutdown xwiki  
13:43 <cjd> sure  
13:43 <vmassol> I'm proposing to use a special logger name for that  
13:43 <vmassol> "org.xwiki.shutdown"  
13:43 <vmassol>     private static final Logger SHUTDOWN\_LOGGER = LoggerFactory.getLogger("org.xwiki.shutdown");  
13:44 <vmassol> so any code that wants to log shutdown stuff would use that logger  
13:44 <vmassol> wdyt?  
13:44 <vmassol> this makes it easy to enable all shutdown logs in one go in our log file  
13:44 <cjd> ok from my perspective  
13:44 <vmassol>   <logger name="org.xwiki.shutdown" level="debug"/>  
13:44 <vmassol> so far we've always used full class name and no cross-cutting converns  
13:45 <vmassol> \*converns  
13:45 <vmassol> \*concerns  
13:45 <vmassol> :)  
13:45 <vmassol> hence my asking...  
13:45 <cjd> it's not a big deal for me as long as "org.xwiki.shutdown" is in every file which uses the logger  
13:45 <cjd> that way I can search for the string  
13:48 <vmassol> I guess the real question behind this is whether we're prepared to start using cross-cutting logger names  
13:58 <vmassol> FTR here's what I get for now when I enable debug for this logger:  
13:58 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/61c2d00a0fb965e59b56/raw/3f882a4432986dfb2003130492beee239485522b/gistfile1.txt  
13:58 <vmassol> (when all goes right)  
13:59 <cjd> 2014-09-23 13:54:05,735 [Thread-1] DEBUG o.x.shutdown                   - Database Connection Pool has been stopped  
13:59 <cjd> 2014-09-23 13:54:10,514 [Thread-1] DEBUG o.x.shutdown                   - Component [org.xwiki.search.solr.internal.DefaultSolrIndexer] has been stopped  
13:59 <cjd> uh oh :)  
13:59 <vmassol> wdym?  
14:00 <cjd> maybe consider making that stuff INFO level since it's only on stop  
14:00 <vmassol> well  
14:00 <vmassol> initially I wanted to do that  
14:00 <cjd> stopping the SolrIndexer after the DB connection pool is stopped ... cannot end well  
14:00 <vmassol> but if you do this then you also need to do the same for initilization  
14:00 <vmassol> and so far we've been trying to have as clean as possible logs  
14:00 <vmassol> by default  
14:01 <vmassol> cjd: ah yes I thought about this too  
14:01 <vmassol> this is actually why I wanted to put those logs in ;)  
14:01 <vmassol> (to check this)  
14:01 <cjd> another thought is another level, if you'd like to avoid the log spam  
14:01 <cjd> INFO2 ? :)  
14:01 <cjd> MOREINFO  
14:01 <cjd> NOTQUITEDEBUG  
14:01 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <vmassol> I prefer a new logging category  
14:02 <vmassol> this seems a better practice  
14:03 <Slashman> has quit  
14:04 <vmassol> if you stop really fast before init is finished this is what you get: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/4695cce1e7d9ed843702/raw/d6c8d55e10874c3cd90c42a2d16a39a69a659620/gistfile1.txt  
14:05 <vmassol> so changing the order won't be enough we also need to make DefaultSolrIndexer respond to a stop  
14:05 <cjd> similar if you start a fresh instance and don't wait a few minutes for solr to index everything  
14:06 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <Slashman\_> has quit  
14:10 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:24 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau, tmortagne and vmassol: We need to fix the webjars access issue (I can`t find the issue number) before we start using them more. http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/47/org.xwiki.enterprise%24xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui/LoginTest/testRedirectPreservesPOSTParameters/ is caused by webjars not being accessible to guests that have been denied view rights on the wiki, so the expected javascript does not l  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> so we need to fix it asap  
14:24 <vmassol> Enygma`: yes I'm on it, ok I'll do a hack for now  
14:24 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <Enygma`> ok, good thing we know about it.  
14:27 <vmassol> it'll take some time to fix correctly (several days) so I'll start with a hack  
14:28 <vmassol> and continue looking for the proper fix  
14:28 <vmassol> I need this hack for 6.2.x branch anyway  
14:28 <vmassol> since the real fix is too complex for that branch  
14:31 <vmassol> ok I have the hack :) committing  
14:37 <vmassol> (improving it slightly first)  
14:41 <gdelhumeau> Is is the XWIKI-11073 issue if I remember well  
14:44 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <vmassol> should be ok now  
14:46 <vmassol> please check my commit and tell me if you think there are other actions using "unknown". If there are then my fix might have created a security issue for them  
14:46 <vmassol> the real fix is XWIKI-10881  
14:48 <vmassol> hmm wait  
14:48 <vmassol> forget that  
14:51 <Slashman> has quit  
14:56 <polx> has quit  
14:58 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <msmeria> has quit  
15:28 <gdelhumeau> evalica: should we introduce the  Interface and Content Language Separation in 6.2.1 (regarding XWIKI-10745)?  
15:29 <evalica> well we could … although is more a bonus feature improvement, than a stabilization  
15:30 <evalica> gdelhumeau: let me do the 'math' of preferences … and see what solution we need to implement  
15:34 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: sounds like a big change for a 6.2.1  
15:35 <gdelhumeau> because currently it looks like this: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/28244/screenshot.png  
15:35 <evalica> well 6.2.x needs to be 'fully functional' so we need a solution since it doens't look very nice in the screenshot  
15:36 <tmortagne> really separating content language and interface means a bit more than just how you display that list  
15:36 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
15:39 <tmortagne> right now pretty much all the code is based on XWiki#getLanguagePreference  
15:40 <tmortagne> so there is a lot of things to refactor to really separate the two  
15:41 <tmortagne> also you have only one current language in LocalizationScriptService  
15:41 <tmortagne> which is the standard way to access this information now (which internally is based on XWiki#getLanguagePreference)  
15:46 <evalica> if there are big changes, we could commit them in master … and after maybe we stabilize them, commit them in 6.2.3+?  
15:52 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_0> Hello all, I have problem with authentication via LDAP in xwiki. I cannot login with some credentials, because ldapsearch is limited to 1000 entries on xwiki site. I don't know where to set size limit in xwiki configuration. This is output from ldapserach from xwiki site: http://pastebin.com/0s0bvzF4 and this is from manual ldapsearch created by me:  http://pastebin.com/9n4isrrU Ldapserver is openldap and xwiki has 6.2 enterp  
16:14 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_0: XWiki not set this limit actually, just checked and it seems to be some default in jldap (that we use for accessing LDAP), did not know that  
16:15 <Enygma`> vmassol: any idea about what is causing this? http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-6.2.x/52/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-activeinstalls-client-api/testReport/org.xwiki.activeinstalls.internal.client/DefaultPingSenderIntegrationTest/sendPingThroughProxy/  
16:15 <Enygma`> I remember I reproduced it locally yesterday on master  
16:17 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_0: it should not be hard to introduce some configuration to override it (would be great if you could create an issue about that on http://jira.xwiki.org) but in the meantime the only way to change that is a patched class  
16:17 <vmassol> Enygma`: I haven't investigated so far  
16:17 <vmassol> you want me to do so?  
16:18 <vmassol> what I would do  
16:18 <vmassol> is try to use a different port than 80  
16:18 <vmassol> since it's possible that using this port requires root access to the machine no?  
16:18 <Enygma`> the annoying thing is that since platform-6.2.x fails to build, all other 6.2.x jobs do not trigger  
16:18 <vmassol> then the ip looks weird: 127.0.53.53  
16:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:18 <vmassol> it should be localhost I guess  
16:19 <Enygma`> that was my main concern  
16:19 <Enygma`> I did not really investigate it myself  
16:19 <vmassol> actually  
16:19 <vmassol> the port I use in the test is 8888  
16:19 <vmassol> public WireMockRule proxyWireMockRule = new WireMockRule(8888);  
16:19 <vmassol> System.setProperty("http.proxyHost", "localhost");  
16:19 <vmassol> System.setProperty("http.proxyPort", "8888");  
16:20 <vmassol> maybe there's some /etc/hosts file pointing localhsot to this ip  
16:20 <vmassol> (on this agent)  
16:22 <vmassol> the ping url used is defined here:  
16:22 <vmassol> DefaultActiveInstallsConfiguration  
16:22 <vmassol> return this.configuration.getProperty(PREFIX + "pingURL", DEFAULT\_PING\_URL);  
16:22 <vmassol> ahah  
16:22 <vmassol> private static final String DEFAULT\_PING\_URL = "http://extensions.xwiki.org/activeinstalls";  
16:22 <vmassol> so maybe in this test for some reason  
16:22 <vmassol> the property is not defined  
16:23 <vmassol> activeinstalls.pingURL  
16:23 <vmassol> and this it used DEFAULT\_PING\_URL  
16:23 <vmassol> \*uses  
16:23 <vmassol> hmm no  
16:23 <vmassol> I have a mock for it  
16:23 <vmassol> when(configuration.getPingInstanceURL()).thenReturn("http://host");  
16:25 <vmassol> can you reproduce locally?  
16:25 <Enygma`> told you I did it yesterday  
16:25 <vmassol> if so it should be easy to find out the rpobe  
16:26 <Enygma`> trying again on master  
16:26 <vmassol> then it's easy :)  
16:26 <vmassol> you want me to look at it?  
16:26 <vmassol> trying to see if I reproduce first  
16:29 <Enygma`> yes, just reproduced it  
16:30 <vmassol> me too  
16:30 <Enygma`> http://hastebin.com/asipudexox.avrasm  
16:30 <vmassol> looking at it in 5 minutes  
16:30 <Enygma`> sure  
16:35 <vmassol> ok I know  
16:35 <vmassol> fixing  
16:35 <vmassol> no idea why it worked before though  
16:36 <vmassol> might be because IP 127.0.53.53 just got enabled, see https://www.icann.org/news/announcement-2-2014-08-01-en ;)  
16:37 <vmassol> http://serverfault.com/questions/626612/dns-just-started-resolving-my-server-prod-addresses-to-127-0-53-53  
16:38 <vmassol> so yes I think it's because DNS just started resolving "host" to this ip ;)  
16:38 <vmassol> that explains why it happens now  
16:38 <vmassol> anyway the test is too fragile  
16:38 <vmassol> fixing that  
16:46 <vmassol> fixing other places too  
16:50 <vmassol> Enygma`: should be ok now  
16:55 <Enygma`> vmassol: interesting, did not know about that.  
16:55 <vmassol> me neither
